Instruction: Add Green Beans: Add the trimmed green beans to the pan and cook for 3-4 minutes, stirring occasionally, until they start to soften and turn slightly blistered.
Optional Additions (Step 1): If using, add the chopped red onion to the pan along with the green beans and cook for an additional 2-3 minutes, or until the onion is softened and translucent.

Incorporate Tomatoes and Broth (Optional):  For a saucier version, add the diced cherry tomatoes and (optional) chicken broth to the pan. Bring to a simmer and cook for 5-7 minutes, or until the tomatoes soften and the liquid reduces slightly.

Season and Simmer: Season the green beans with salt, freshly ground black pepper, and a pinch of crushed red pepper flakes (optional). Reduce heat to low and simmer for an additional 2-3 minutes, or until the green beans are tender-crisp to your liking.
Optional Additions (Step 2): If using, stir in the chopped fresh parsley and lemon juice for a brighter flavor.
Garnish and Serve: Turn off the heat and stir in the chopped fresh basil leaves.  Transfer the cooked green beans to a serving plate. Optional: Sprinkle with grated Parmesan cheese for extra flavor.
Enjoy:** Serve the Italian-style green beans hot as a delicious side dish. You can enjoy them alongside grilled meats, pasta dishes, or fish.
